Journal.Title: Bulletin of environmental contamination and toxicology

Article.ArticleTitle: Impact of the Petrochemical Complex on the Air Quality of an Urban Area in the City of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.

AbstractText: In the city of Rio de Janeiro (Brazil), the districts located in the northern area are considered the most critical regarding ozone levels year-round. In this study, the potential factors that contribute to high levels of ozone in the district of Irajá were investigated. The obtained results clearly showed that, in spite of the high correlation of ozone concentrations with wind speed and temperature, ozone episodes depend on the ratios of volatile organic compounds (VOCs) to nitrogen oxides (NO<sub>x</sub>) rather than on the individual VOC and NO<sub>x</sub> levels, as expected for the VOC-controlled condition typical of the urban area of Rio de Janeiro. Moreover, high VOCs/NO<sub>x</sub> ratios are highly dependent on the transport of air masses. When pollutants are transported from urban areas with heavy vehicular flux and high NO<sub>x</sub> concentrations, ozone levels are reduced. When air masses are transported from the industrial petrochemical area, NO<sub>x</sub> levels are relatively low, and ozone episodes are frequent.
